# Visualising Distribution
## Getting Started
### Installing and loading the packages


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(ggdist, ggridges, ggthemes,
               colorspace, tidyverse)
```
:::


### Data import


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
exam <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")
```
:::


## Visualising Distribution with Ridgeline Plot
### Plotting ridgeline graph: ggridges method
::: panel-tabset
### The plot


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### The code


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(exam, 
       aes(x = ENGLISH, 
           y = CLASS)) +
  geom_density_ridges(
    scale = 3,
    rel_min_height = 0.01,
    bandwidth = 3.4,
    fill = lighten("#7097BB", .3),
    color = "white"
  ) +
  scale_x_continuous(
    name = "English grades",
    expand = c(0, 0)
    ) +
  scale_y_discrete(name = NULL, expand = expansion(add = c(0.2, 2.6))) +
  theme_ridges()
```
:::


:::
### Varying fill colors along the x axis
::: panel-tabset
### The plot


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### The code


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(exam, 
       aes(x = ENGLISH, 
           y = CLASS,
           fill = stat(x))) +
  geom_density_ridges_gradient(
    scale = 3,
    rel_min_height = 0.01) +
  scale_fill_viridis_c(name = "Temp. [F]",
                       option = "C") +
  scale_x_continuous(
    name = "English grades",
    expand = c(0, 0)
  ) +
  scale_y_discrete(name = NULL, expand = expansion(add = c(0.2, 2.6))) +
  theme_ridges()
```
:::


:::
###  Mapping the probabilities directly onto colour
::: panel-tabset
### The plot


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### The code


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(exam,
       aes(x = ENGLISH, 
           y = CLASS, 
           fill = 0.5 - abs(0.5-stat(ecdf)))) +
  stat_density_ridges(geom = "density_ridges_gradient", 
                      calc_ecdf = TRUE) +
  scale_fill_viridis_c(name = "Tail probability",
                       direction = -1) +
  theme_ridges()
```
:::


:::
::: panel-tabset
### The plot


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### The code


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(exam,
       aes(x = ENGLISH, 
           y = CLASS, 
           fill = factor(stat(quantile))
           )) +
  stat_density_ridges(
    geom = "density_ridges_gradient",
    calc_ecdf = TRUE, 
    quantiles = 4,
    quantile_lines = TRUE) +
  scale_fill_viridis_d(name = "Quartiles") +
  theme_ridges()
```
:::


:::
::: panel-tabset
### The plot


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### The code


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(exam,
       aes(x = ENGLISH, 
           y = CLASS, 
           fill = factor(stat(quantile))
           )) +
  stat_density_ridges(
    geom = "density_ridges_gradient",
    calc_ecdf = TRUE, 
    quantiles = c(0.025, 0.975)
    ) +
  scale_fill_manual(
    name = "Probability",
    values = c("#FF0000A0", "#A0A0A0A0", "#0000FFA0"),
    labels = c("(0, 0.025]", "(0.025, 0.975]", "(0.975, 1]")
  ) +
  theme_ridges()
```
:::


:::
## Visualising Distribution with Raincloud Plot
### Plotting a Half Eye graph
::: panel-tabset
### The plot


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-13-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### The code


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(exam, 
       aes(x = RACE, 
           y = ENGLISH)) +
  stat_halfeye(adjust = 0.5,
               justification = -0.2,
               .width = 0,
               point_colour = NA)
```
:::


:::
### Adding the boxplot with geom_boxplot()
::: panel-tabset
### The plot


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-15-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### The code


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(exam, 
       aes(x = RACE, 
           y = ENGLISH)) +
  stat_halfeye(adjust = 0.5,
               justification = -0.2,
               .width = 0,
               point_colour = NA) +
  geom_boxplot(width = .20,
               outlier.shape = NA)
```
:::


:::
### Adding the Dot Plots with stat_dots()
::: panel-tabset
### The plot


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-17-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### The code


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(exam, 
       aes(x = RACE, 
           y = ENGLISH)) +
  stat_halfeye(adjust = 0.5,
               justification = -0.2,
               .width = 0,
               point_colour = NA) +
  geom_boxplot(width = .20,
               outlier.shape = NA) +
  stat_dots(side = "left", 
            justification = 1.2, 
            binwidth = .5,
            dotsize = 2)
```
:::


:::
### Finishing touch
::: panel-tabset
### The plot


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-19-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### The code


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(exam, 
       aes(x = RACE, 
           y = ENGLISH)) +
  stat_halfeye(adjust = 0.5,
               justification = -0.2,
               .width = 0,
               point_colour = NA) +
  geom_boxplot(width = .20,
               outlier.shape = NA) +
  stat_dots(side = "left", 
            justification = 1.2, 
            binwidth = .5,
            dotsize = 1.5) +
  coord_flip() +
  theme_economist()
```
:::


:::
# Visual Statistical Analysis with ggstatsplot
## Getting Started
### Installing and launching R packages


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(ggstatsplot, tidyverse, qqplotr)
```
:::


### Importing data


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
exam <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")
```
:::


## One-sample test: gghistostats() method


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(1234)

gghistostats(
  data = exam,
  x = ENGLISH,
  type = "bayes",
  test.value = 60,
  xlab = "English scores"
)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-23-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Two-sample mean test: ggbetweenstats()


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggbetweenstats(
  data = exam,
  x = GENDER, 
  y = MATHS,
  type = "np",
  messages = FALSE
)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-24-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Oneway ANOVA Test: ggbetweenstats() method


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggbetweenstats(
  data = exam,
  x = RACE, 
  y = ENGLISH,
  type = "p",
  mean.ci = TRUE, 
  pairwise.comparisons = TRUE, 
  pairwise.display = "s",
  p.adjust.method = "fdr",
  messages = FALSE
)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-25-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


###  Significant Test of Correlation: ggscatterstats()


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggscatterstats(
  data = exam,
  x = MATHS,
  y = ENGLISH,
  marginal = FALSE,
  )
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-26-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### Significant Test of Association (Depedence) : ggbarstats() methods


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
exam1 <- exam %>% 
  mutate(MATHS_bins = 
           cut(MATHS, 
               breaks = c(0,60,75,85,100))
)
ggbarstats(exam1, 
           x = MATHS_bins, 
           y = GENDER)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-27-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


# Visualising Models
## Getting Started


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(readxl, performance, parameters, see)
```
:::


### Importing Excel file: readxl methods


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
car_resale <- read_xls("data/ToyotaCorolla.xls", 
                       "data")
car_resale
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 1,436 × 38
      Id Model    Price Age_08_04 Mfg_Month Mfg_Year     KM Quarterly_Tax Weight
   <dbl> <chr>    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>  <dbl>         <dbl>  <dbl>
 1    81 TOYOTA … 18950        25         8     2002  20019           100   1180
 2     1 TOYOTA … 13500        23        10     2002  46986           210   1165
 3     2 TOYOTA … 13750        23        10     2002  72937           210   1165
 4     3  TOYOTA… 13950        24         9     2002  41711           210   1165
 5     4 TOYOTA … 14950        26         7     2002  48000           210   1165
 6     5 TOYOTA … 13750        30         3     2002  38500           210   1170
 7     6 TOYOTA … 12950        32         1     2002  61000           210   1170
 8     7  TOYOTA… 16900        27         6     2002  94612           210   1245
 9     8 TOYOTA … 18600        30         3     2002  75889           210   1245
10    44 TOYOTA … 16950        27         6     2002 110404           234   1255
# ℹ 1,426 more rows
# ℹ 29 more variables: Guarantee_Period <dbl>, HP_Bin <chr>, CC_bin <chr>,
#   Doors <dbl>, Gears <dbl>, Cylinders <dbl>, Fuel_Type <chr>, Color <chr>,
#   Met_Color <dbl>, Automatic <dbl>, Mfr_Guarantee <dbl>,
#   BOVAG_Guarantee <dbl>, ABS <dbl>, Airbag_1 <dbl>, Airbag_2 <dbl>,
#   Airco <dbl>, Automatic_airco <dbl>, Boardcomputer <dbl>, CD_Player <dbl>,
#   Central_Lock <dbl>, Powered_Windows <dbl>, Power_Steering <dbl>, …
```


:::
:::


###  Multiple Regression Model using lm()


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
model <- lm(Price ~ Age_08_04 + Mfg_Year + KM + 
              Weight + Guarantee_Period, data = car_resale)
model
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Call:
lm(formula = Price ~ Age_08_04 + Mfg_Year + KM + Weight + Guarantee_Period, 
    data = car_resale)

Coefficients:
     (Intercept)         Age_08_04          Mfg_Year                KM  
      -2.637e+06        -1.409e+01         1.315e+03        -2.323e-02  
          Weight  Guarantee_Period  
       1.903e+01         2.770e+01  
```


:::
:::


### Model Diagnostic: checking for multicolinearity:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
check_collinearity(model)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# Check for Multicollinearity

Low Correlation

             Term  VIF     VIF 95% CI Increased SE Tolerance Tolerance 95% CI
               KM 1.46 [ 1.37,  1.57]         1.21      0.68     [0.64, 0.73]
           Weight 1.41 [ 1.32,  1.51]         1.19      0.71     [0.66, 0.76]
 Guarantee_Period 1.04 [ 1.01,  1.17]         1.02      0.97     [0.86, 0.99]

High Correlation

      Term   VIF     VIF 95% CI Increased SE Tolerance Tolerance 95% CI
 Age_08_04 31.07 [28.08, 34.38]         5.57      0.03     [0.03, 0.04]
  Mfg_Year 31.16 [28.16, 34.48]         5.58      0.03     [0.03, 0.04]
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_c <- check_collinearity(model)
plot(check_c)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-31-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### Model Diagnostic: checking normality assumption


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
model1 <- lm(Price ~ Age_08_04 + KM + 
              Weight + Guarantee_Period, data = car_resale)
check_n <- check_normality(model1)
plot(check_n)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-32-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### Model Diagnostic: Check model for homogeneity of variances


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
check_h <- check_heteroscedasticity(model1)
plot(check_h)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-33-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### Model Diagnostic: Complete check


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
check_model(model1)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-34-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### Visualising Regression Parameters: see methods


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(parameters(model1))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-35-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


###  Visualising Regression Parameters: ggcoefstats() methods


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggcoefstats(model1, 
            output = "plot")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-36-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::
